intro: Trianthema polyspermum, commonly known as the many-seeded sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas. Trianthema polyspermum is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
